annotation.TEXT: Okay, the castle was all the way over here for some reason. And the castle's presence cuts off a corner for a cloud for some reason.
Huh. I'm surprised that my fireball hit that guy. Also, his shell changed color when he died. That's strange.
Demo count: Still 1, actually.

Unfortunately, I think 2000 was the highest I could've gotten from the flagpole there, but I can still get the 6 fireworks, which like to sometimes appear on the opposite side of the screen if the screen didn't scroll far enough.
Umm... Bowser, I hate to break it to you, but... You lose!
Demo count: 1
And yes, I could've gotten on the roof here, but I want to stay in the "usual" play area for the most part.
Well, it works normally. (Yes, I risked my life to test that.)
I should be able to get this stuff and then climb back up with no problem.
Huh. It's unusual to see a Bullet Bill that didn't come from a cannon or a random generator.
LOL, so it was a Kaizo trap!
A piranha plant without a pipe? Now that's strange. What's also strange is the remnants that appear after it's killed (which are normally hidden by the pipe it's in, but there's no pipe here).
Ow, my spine! Darn, I was expecting my invincibility to last through that bullet.
And this just leads to a flagpole anyway, but I should be able to get 5000 from this one.
There's another unusually-placed springboard.
Oh, there's a hidden block! That'll make continuing to the right easy!

Ha! My brain's been training, with Brain Age and Big Brain Academy! (I love being able to stomp things with the back of my head like that in SMB! You just have to be descending at the time the collision occurs.)

Wow, thanks to this hack's generosity, I'm already up to 10 lives! (Wouldn't it be funny if I somehow collected enough lives for them to go negative and Game Over me on the next death without doing the shell-on-the-stairs trick?)
Well, that just happened, and this kind of interrupted with what I was going to say there... So, where do I respawn?
Either way, I'm heading to 2-1, alive and well! Does 2-1 look strangely familiar to those that watched episode 0? Find out next time! To be continued...
Does Mario in the demo still have a mushroom phobia? ...Yep.
Okay, I've gone back to before I entered this pipe here, and I just won't enter this pipe this time.
I wonder what's in that brick below... Well, I'd try to check, but my time is kind of limited here, so forget it.
Space-time rewind count: 1
Huh. I wonder if the trick to this bonus room is that I want to avoid exiting it for as long as possible...
Whoa! This game's trying to kill me, man! Fortunately, if you hold A as you're "emerging" like that...
And it was just one screen before where I "emerged" earlier. Also, SMB has some glitchiness when it comes to there being more than one springboard on the screen at once.
Why is it that a mushroom that just came out of a block will sometimes do a little hop like that?
Demo count: 2

So, right near the start here is a hidden coin block that I stumbled upon while giving this version of the hack a quick test run, which you can use to more easily reach this 1-up, although it's not required.
Alright, now this time, I'm playing on my usual NES emulator, and with a proper version of the hack. So, let's just watch the demo again here...
Nice "no clip" cheat there, Mario!

Yep, totally. Let's just skip the multi-coin block entirely this time. Now, as I was saying earlier, if you hold A as you're "emerging" from a pipe, the game will still let you jump immediately when you get control of Mario, even if you're in midair.
Alright, so let's get this party started!
Ooh... Do I drop down for all those coins, or do I stay on the top path?
Not gonna bother with the parakoopa this time, and I'm not going to go over the pipe to the warp zone screen again this time either.
Hello, and welcome to "Super Super Mario Bros ©1985 Nintendo The New Strange Mario Bros! --©1999 ACMLM--"!
Alright, enough with the easy 1-ups, game! Also, is that an axe? Like the kind you'd normally see on the right side of Bowser's bridge in castles?
What? A warp zone? But there's also a standard flagpole too. Well, I don't want to skip entire levels or worlds, so I'll take the flagpole.
Whoops, lost another 1-up because I was too hasty in my brick-hitting (not that I needed it).
And six fireworks is always nice too. Umm... Where's the castle?
Whoops, scrolled too far, and I don't think the game will let me stand on that tiny piece of brick that's still showing. But, I should be able to jump onto the mushroom platform... I think.
Ah, it's a 1-up. And escaping here will be simpler than it looks, due to SMB's physics when it comes to moving platforms and solid blocks.
Okay, let's not die in a silly way this time. However, I would like to check out that brick on the lower path here this time.
I'll take "Squid Squishing" for 1000, Alex.
Still, I made out quite well, but now where am I? And can I reach a goal in time?
So, the game's given me star power, and a springboard that I could've used to get on the roof, but once again, I want to stay down here.
Huh. The screen scrolls to the right here. I wonder if I can get over there...
I want the coins!
Wait, is this not the warp zone screen that I just saw?
So, what's the castle like?
Umm... I am not going to hit that last brick. If it breaks, I'd be stuck (barring a wall jump), since the exit pipe has scrolled off the screen.
That's strange... I wonder why there's a springboard there...
Alright, I'm back here, where I was going through the wall. Now this time, let's not jump on the axe.
Bright blue skies underground. Sure, why not? Also, this first pipe goes places...
I'm a little surprised that that pipe at the start there wasn't enterable, but I guess we can't have exit-enabled pipes absolutely everywhere, right?
Okay, I guess I did trigger midpoint somehow.
Yeah, no fancy transition effects in this video, as I didn't run this footage through WMM at all. Also, there's yet another 1-up.
Unfortunately, you only get 200 points when you star kill Bowser (compared to 5000 from using fireballs).
I betcha I can go down that pipe, and I betcha it leads to the same bonus room again.
So, yeah. Same as before, except the sky is a brighter color than last time, and I won't be in world 0-1 when I start the game this time!

By the way, if the video appeared to bug out at all for you guys just as the beginning of 4-1 was briefly shown back there, I blame YouTube and/or Google, as my original footage doesn't have an oddity there.
Fake Kaizo trap count: 2 (includes the cancelled-out one)
So, let's see what the second level has to offer...
This looks like an ending staircase... Yep, it's an ending staircase alright, just like in 1-3 of the original game, but with every other column changed into bricks.
Ooh, 1-up!
Ooh, but now I've missed out on what's over there... Unless I can glitch myself through the wall, like this!
Yes, made it! Alright, let's try to avoid such a time-consuming situation again.
LOL, it did that thing again. Fortunately, I now know that this doesn't actually kill me. Huh, had I gone onto the roof earlier, I could've cleared the level with the flagpole instead, but whatever.
Okay, I can enter this pipe...
Now, unlike the demo, I do not have a mushroom phobia (unless we're talking about poison mushrooms, but I don't think there would be any in this hack, since it's not a hack of 2J (The Lost Levels)).
Yeah, you can't clobber piranha plants with kicked shells in SMB, so just be aware of that.
Whoops, got too hasty and lost a 1-up to the 1 item limit.
What the heck?! That looked like one of Bowser's flames, but with its vertical hold screwed up! Good thing for my star power!
Oh, almost. Maybe if I scroll the screen a little more...
If I'd gone over the roof earlier, I'd've reached it easily, but let's see if I can glitch through the wall again to get to it...
Oh, what? I'm here again? Well, I'm not going to go over the top of the whole enchilada this time, so I'll just take this pipe exit here.
...Wait, what? World 2-1? And it turns out I didn't die after all? Well, I'm not done with world 1 yet, so... Un momento, por favor...
Huzzah! Now, what happens when I jump on it?
Yep, and even though the warp zone message and numbers over the pipes weren't showing, it still worked correctly. However, I didn't want to go to world 4-1 yet...
Well, we're starting off with random bullets, for one thing.
Space-time rewind count: 2
